page.title: 04Farming continued
page.content: make larger fields for easier working. Most of the small fields are on the farms near the village. Most of the land in the area is flat.To the North the land starts to roll.Most of the soil is heavy.There are patches of lighter soil. Thirteen farms are mixed and two are arable.Seven of the farmers grow sugar beet,because there is a Sugar Beet Factory in York.Each farmer uses some land for stock and some for growing barley,wheat and oats.Oil seed rape,peas and turnips are grown also. There is permanent grass near the River Kyle which is not worth cultivating because it floods in Winter. All the farmers have a grain barn of some sort.Some own a dutch barn for storing machinery.Five
